oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of an athlete with her manager, a landscape, a horse and rider, dancing women, President Coolidge, and a princess. Nashville Tennessean, 1928 October 21.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hill, Martha; Hottum; Crowell. H.; McLaughlin, Velva Rose; Garner, Ruth; Reeves, Gladys; Savarrino, Eva; English, Barbara; Coolidge, Calvin; Matsudaira, Setsuko; Huddleston, Myrtle; Bow, Clara
Nashville Tennessean
Swimming; Landscapes (Representations); Horses; Dancers; Presidents; Rulers
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a competitive swimmer from Memphis with her manager, a coastal Virginia landscape, a horse and rider clearing a hurdle at the Brockton Fair Horse Show in Massachusetts, a group of dancing women from the Gladys Reeves Dancing School in Memphis, President Coolidge, and a Japanese princess. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
